content.new:
I am unable to see any movement of the vehicles in the logs downloaded from the Ignition Robotics submission portal for virtualstix \(log is completely missing, see issue #131\), tunnel\_practice\_2, and tunnel\_practice\_1. I’ve tried multiple cloudsim submissions to different environments without success despite having success running this image against a local cloudsim.  As far as I can tell on the Ignition Robotics portal, there were no errors when launching the Docker images and I was able to download and run the log file from the run successfully.

‌

The exact setup I’m using is outlined below in the Dockerfile, entrypoint.sh, and cmd\_vel\_pubs.launch where I build an image with those 3 files and then push it to my team repo, copy the uri, and then start the submission process with 4 different vehicles named accordingly and supply them each this image.

‌

Dockerfile:

```
FROM nkoenig/subt-virtual-testbed

COPY docker/simple_submit/entrypoint.sh ./entrypoint.sh
COPY docker/simple_submit/cmd_vel_pubs.launch ./cmd_vel_pubs.launch
ENTRYPOINT ["./entrypoint.sh"]
```

entrypoint.sh:

```bash
#!/usr/bin/env bash

. /opt/ros/melodic/setup.bash
. /home/developer/subt_ws/install/setup.bash

exec roslaunch cmd_vel_pubs.launch
```

cmd\_vel\_pubs.launch:

```
<launch>

  <node pkg="rostopic" type="rostopic" name="alpha_vel" args="pub -r 1.0 /alpha/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist '{linear: {x: 0.5}, angular: {z: 1.0}}'" output="screen"/>
  <node pkg="rostopic" type="rostopic" name="bravo_vel" args="pub -r 1.0 /bravo/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist '{linear: {x: 0.5}, angular: {z: 1.0}}'" output="screen"/>
  <node pkg="rostopic" type="rostopic" name="charlie_vel" args="pub -r 1.0 /charlie/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist '{linear: {x: 0.5, z: 20.0}, angular: {z: 1.0}}'" output="screen"/>
  <node pkg="rostopic" type="rostopic" name="delta_vel" args="pub -r 1.0 /delta/cmd_vel geometry_msgs/Twist '{linear: {x: 0.5, z: 40.0}, angular: {z: 1.0}}'" output="screen"/>

</launch>
```

‌

[Legacy documentation of the procedure I’m using for different robot names](https://bitbucket.org/jgrogers/subt_hello_world/wiki/Example%20Cloudsim%20Submission)
